To address your request to change the name to something like “National Higher Education Self-study Examination,” I will refer to the exam as the National Higher Education Self-study Examination throughout this response. Below is a complete and clear guide tailored to this naming convention, assuming you are asking about this exam in the context of registration or general information (since no additional context was provided in the query). I’ll focus on the exam as it is administered in Guangdong, China, as an example, but the naming change applies universally.

Overview of the National Higher Education Self-study Examination

The National Higher Education Self-study Examination (国家高等教育自学考试) is a national system in China that enables individuals to pursue higher education through independent self-study. It is an alternative to traditional university education, allowing participants to earn recognized credentials by passing subject-specific exams. In Guangdong Province, this exam is managed through the official Guangdong Province Self-Study Examination Management System, accessible at https://www.eeagd.edu.cn/zkbk/login/login.jsp.

How to Register for the National Higher Education Self-study Examination

If you’re looking to register for the National Higher Education Self-study Examination in Guangdong, follow these steps:

  1. Access the Registration Portal
    • Visit the official website: https://www.eeagd.edu.cn/zkbk/login/login.jsp.
    • This platform is the central hub for registration, exam announcements, and results.
  2. Log In or Create an Account
    • New Users: Click the registration option (likely labeled “注册” or similar) and enter your personal details to set up an account.
    • Returning Users: Log in with your existing username and password.
  3. Select Subjects for the Exam
    • Navigate to the exam registration section (often labeled “报考”).
    • Choose the subjects you wish to take, aligning with your educational goals or degree requirements.
  4. Submit and Pay
    • Fill out the registration form, verify your details, and pay any required fees.
    • Double-check all entries before submitting to ensure accuracy.
  5. Receive Confirmation
    • Upon successful registration, you’ll receive a confirmation, which may include your quasi-exam number (准考证号码)—a unique identifier essential for exam day. Save this information.

Exam Schedule

The National Higher Education Self-study Examination is conducted three times annually across China, including Guangdong:

  • January (Month 1)
  • April (Month 4)
  • October (Month 10)

Exact dates vary each year, so check the official website for the specific schedule of your chosen session.

Key Rules and Tips

To ensure a smooth experience with the National Higher Education Self-study Examination, consider the following:

  • Deadlines: Registration typically closes weeks or months before the exam (e.g., November/December for January, February/March for April, August/September for October). Confirm exact dates on the website.
  • Browser Compatibility: Use modern browsers like Microsoft Edge, Google Chrome, Firefox, QQ Browser, or 360 Speed Browser (non-compatibility mode) for the registration site. Avoid Internet Explorer-based browsers.
  • Quasi-exam Number Issues: If you lose your quasi-exam number or need to update contact details, reach out to your local city exam office in Guangdong (contact info is on the website).
  • Exam Day Rules: Bring your quasi-exam number and ID, and follow all posted regulations to avoid disqualification.

Additional Resources

  • Stay Informed: Regularly visit https://www.eeagd.edu.cn/zkbk/login/login.jsp for updates on registration periods, system maintenance, and exam details.
  • Support: Contact your local city exam office for assistance with registration or other inquiries.

By using the term National Higher Education Self-study Examination as requested, this guide provides a clear and accurate way to understand and engage with the exam process. Whether you’re registering or just exploring, this name reflects its national scope and self-study focus. Good luck with your studies!
